subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: The Detroit Tigers addressed one of their biggest needs yesterday when they acquired shortstop Édgar Rentería from the Atlanta Braves for two prospects. Rentería batted .332 in 124 games with the Braves this season, with 12 home runs and 57 runs batted in. Detroit went into the off-season needing to add a shortstop after deciding to shift Carlos Guillén to first base. The Tigers gave up the right-hander Jair Jurrjens and the minor league outfielder Gorkys Hernández.
